Author: heguli97#5781
Content: @dxer666 based on your address type(t1) it looks like you're using the old type of address format, new HUSH v3 start with R like komodo addresses. Do you have the latest version of agama wallet(0.3.6) which supports Hushs' new chain?

Author: heguli97#5781
Content: If you do, then you need to use the WIF TO WIF converter in agama to change the privatekey format to Komodo's.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> hard to tell if the error is talking about a t1 or R address above

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> ok, then it's the correct behavior

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> He has an old GUI wallet, which is talking to a new backend. The new backend knows that t1 is not a valid Hush v3 address is and giving a correct error

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> our backend electrumX servers have exactly the same IPs and ports, so old GUI wallets will be able to connect but won't work correctly
